HDG.LOG.content: [method, cut out the chaff, what cheapens] everything facile, trite & vacuous > send essence of man reeling (ins Wanken bringt), devastate him, if this dispensation becomes destiny [?] [wouldn’t this take us beyond Being?]

HDG.BC.content: [beyond philosophy] indefinite title Grundbegriffe: do not commit ourselves to anything in advance [Heidegger opens] > “readiness to put the essence of man at risk in thinking that which grounds this essence,” that which he takes for being [Heidegger closes?]: “whatever grounds everything and gives ground to everything is itself the ground” [causa sui?]

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [beyond philosophy] indefinite title Grundbegriffe: do not commit ourselves to anything in advance [Heidegger opens] > “readiness to put the essence of man at risk in thinking that which grounds this essence,” that which he takes for being [Heidegger closes?]: “whatever grounds everything and gives ground to everything is itself the ground” [causa sui?]

HDG.BC.content: there is something that doesn’t have to be “effective” or useful in order to be [beyond use and actuality]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: there is something that doesn’t have to be “effective” or useful in order to be [beyond use and actuality]

HDG.BC.content: what is thoughtworthy isn’t “thinking” but what challenges thinking, what places thinking in its service, bestows rank/value on it [thinking beyond “logic” as pathos of distance?]: extend thinking toward manner in which ground includes us in its essence, come into proximity w/ what strikes us essential, become aware, listen our way to where we belong [Gelassenheit]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: what is thoughtworthy isn’t “thinking” but what challenges thinking, what places thinking in its service, bestows rank/value on it [thinking beyond “logic” as pathos of distance?]: extend thinking toward manner in which ground includes us in its essence, come into proximity w/ what strikes us essential, become aware, listen our way to where we belong [Gelassenheit]

HDG.BC.content: experience whole in possibilities (Möglichen)/necessities (Notwendigen) beyond merely actual (nur Wirkliche) > whole of beings: not a sum, not a represented “totality” > [“is” method?] in considering beings as a whole, we think the whole as a being, thus already think it from being [?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: experience whole in possibilities (Möglichen)/necessities (Notwendigen) beyond merely actual (nur Wirkliche) > whole of beings: not a sum, not a represented “totality” > [“is” method?] in considering beings as a whole, we think the whole as a being, thus already think it from being [?]

HDG.BC.content: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.BC.linkedContent: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]

HDG.BC.content: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.BC.linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.TB.content: to think Being explicitly: relinquish Being as ground of beings [beyond ground?] in favor of giving which prevails concealed in unconcealment, in favor of the Es Gibt

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.TB.linkedContent: to think Being explicitly: relinquish Being as ground of beings [beyond ground?] in favor of giving which prevails concealed in unconcealment, in favor of the Es Gibt

HDG.TB.content: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.TB.linkedContent: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself

HDG.WM.content: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WM.linkedContent: Da-sein means: being held out into the nothing > Dasein already beyond beings as whole > such being beyond beings we call transcendence, holding itself out into the nothing, so does/can Dasein adopt a stance toward beings & itself [nihilation of nothing makes possible transcendence of man beyond beings] > w/out nothing, no selfhood, freedom

HDG.WM.content: metaphysics: inquiry beyond or over beings, aims to recover them as a whole for our grasp

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WM.linkedContent: metaphysics: inquiry beyond or over beings, aims to recover them as a whole for our grasp

HDG.WM.content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WM.linkedContent: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.WM.content: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WM.linkedContent: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]

HDG.IWM.content: thinking that sets out to experience ground of metaphysics, attempt to recall truth of Being > [totally other, beyond Being] from point of view of metaphysics ground appears as ground [cf. 279n Being as nonground (Nichtgrund), X ground], presumably something else experienced in its own terms, something as yet unsaid, something other than metaphysics

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: thinking that sets out to experience ground of metaphysics, attempt to recall truth of Being > [totally other, beyond Being] from point of view of metaphysics ground appears as ground [cf. 279n Being as nonground (Nichtgrund), X ground], presumably something else experienced in its own terms, something as yet unsaid, something other than metaphysics

HDG.IWM.content: fundamental ontology (attempt to inquire back), like any title, soon seen to be inappropriate [beyond Being then?], misleading because says something correct from point of view of metaphysics > what matters is undertaking transition [not there yet] from metaphysics to recalling truth of Being > thinking that calls itself “fundamental ontology” blocks/obscures its own path by very designation > attempt to recall truth of Being, going back into ground of metaphysics [Destruction], already left realm of all ontology w/ 1st step [was that step ever taken?] > wherever indirect/direct representation of “transcendence” remains: ontology [cf. On The Essence of Ground p. 125] [cf. OG pp. 22-3]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: fundamental ontology (attempt to inquire back), like any title, soon seen to be inappropriate [beyond Being then?], misleading because says something correct from point of view of metaphysics > what matters is undertaking transition [not there yet] from metaphysics to recalling truth of Being > thinking that calls itself “fundamental ontology” blocks/obscures its own path by very designation > attempt to recall truth of Being, going back into ground of metaphysics [Destruction], already left realm of all ontology w/ 1st step [was that step ever taken?] > wherever indirect/direct representation of “transcendence” remains: ontology [cf. On The Essence of Ground p. 125] [cf. OG pp. 22-3]

HDG.QB.content: for Jünger, technology most decisive anti-Christian power [?] > [Heidegger unloads w/ questions re: Gestalt] >Heidegger finds in Jünger a circular logic beyond “logic” that demands freedom from contradiction: reciprocal relationship btwn determinative (work) & determined (worker)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: for Jünger, technology most decisive anti-Christian power [?] > [Heidegger unloads w/ questions re: Gestalt] >Heidegger finds in Jünger a circular logic beyond “logic” that demands freedom from contradiction: reciprocal relationship btwn determinative (work) & determined (worker)

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.QB.content: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

HDG.QB.content: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.QB.linkedContent: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

HDG.QB.content: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

HDG.FS.content: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

HDG.MA.content: [Derrida beyond Heidegger] [Heidegger describes the homelessness of those who watch Television, listen to radio, go to movies] the rootedness (Bodenständigkeit), the autochthony, of man threatened today at its core: loss of autochthony springs from spirit of age in which we were born: the atomic age (atom bomb: its most conspicuous symbol)

HDG.MA.content: decisive question: how can we tame vast atomic energies, secure mankind against their danger > technological advance will move faster & faster, can’t be stopped > man hasn’t made forces of technology [?], they’ve moved beyond his will, outgrown his capacity for decision

HDG.CCP.content: don’t awaken Gelassenheit in ourselves on our own > is letting-be a kind of passivity? perhaps a higher acting concealed in Gelassenheit? Gelassenheit beyond distinction activity/passivity > transition from willing into Gelassenheit seems difficult

HDG.CCP.content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

HDG.CCP.content: the region gathers, each to each, while resting in itself: “regioning is a gathering and re-sheltering (versammelnde Zurückbergen) for an expanded resting (Beruhen) in an abiding (Weile)” [Gegnet], in Gegnet, openness is halted and held [Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.DL.content: [re: “Expression and Meaning (Ausdruck und Bedeutung [double takes on Erscheinung]”] I was concerned to make visible (sichtbar machen) das ganz Andere [the totally other], which [at that time], I had only an obscure (dunkel) or confused intimation (verworren Geahnte) [Derrida beyond Heidegger: can’t make totally other visible]

HDG.LP.content: the way apartness flames, it is spirit & thus gathering power, Das Versammelnde der Abgeschiedenheit, saves the unborn beyond the used-up for a coming rebirth of mankind, gathering power, spirit of gentleness, stills spirit of evil

HDG.WL.content: everything spoken stems, in many ways, from unspoken (either not yet spoken or beyond reach of speaking) > so that which is spoken can appear cut off from speaking/speakers, but it alone offers (entgegenhält) what they attend to (verhalten), regardless of how they stay (aufhalten) w/in spoken/unspoken

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WL.content: Aufriss of language will remain veiled if we don’t properly attend (eigens beachten) to spoken/unspoken [so we can arrive beyond the veil?]

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.EC.linkedContent: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.EC.content: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.EC.linkedContent: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.OHF.content: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

HDG.OHF.content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

HDG.OHF.content: tarrying awhile (Verweilen), even halting on street, holding out in temporality of everydayness, completely different than occurrence of thing called “man” [beyond humanism]
